action.content:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

Your goal for this game is: Put the book on the table, the plate on the table and the mop on the table.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a bedroom now. There are a bed, a pillow and a wardrobe. The pillow is on the bed. The wardrobe is closed. There is a passage to a living room here.
The wardrobe is now open. The wardrobe is empty.

> close wardrobe

> go to passage

> enter living room

> look around

I am in the living room. There is a table, a bookshelf, and a door leading to the kitchen. The table has a plate on it. The bookshelf has several books.

> go to bookshelf

> take book from bookshelf

> go to table

> put book on table

> go to kitchen

> open kitchen door
